alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Greene; Hale; Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:46AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Tuscaloosa, northeastern Greene, northeastern Hale and southwestern Bibb Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 245 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Knoxville, or 15 miles northeast of Eutaw, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brent, Centreville, Moundville, Union, West Centreville, Shelton State Community College, Low Gap, Mertz, Jena, Knoxville, Talladega National Forest, Eoline, Mantua, Snoddy, Englewood, Ralph, Little Sandy, Maxwell, Moundville Airport and Fosters Boat Landing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
